title: (x) two rounded tech sans - Infinity/Variable {Robert Dalen/Mike Y}
content:
Hi Guys,

A new client has approached me to design a new logo/identity for her Interior Design company called “Modern Spaces”.  
Her work is incredible and is very minimalist with a focus on custom made surroundings.

Anyway- she has provided my with the following sample of particular typefaces she likes. (attached)

I’m wondering if any one can name them? : )

I’m stoked they aren’t Arial!  
Also while we are at it what are some of your all time favorite contemporary type faces?

I’m looking into “FF Din” where would I find the history behind this font.

Thanks in advance!

Jason

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_1_6015.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font_2_3879.jpg)

 [‹ (x) DAGEN project grotesque - custom font by E-Types {Peter Monrad}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20775 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Number 7 on Vegas slot machines - various alternatives {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20791 "Go to next forum topic")
author: J_P_C

comments.content:
Also; [DIN Alternatives](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755/http:/www.typophile.com/node/20442).

DIN is overused, there are many fresh alternatives out there worth considering.

As for IDing these samples, the top one could be custom as the E looks optically odd. :^P

e.j.horrocks looks like [’Variable’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080312104755/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/variable/) from MadType.

- Mike Yanega
It is Thirstype Infinity Light from the look of the j and R

Thanks for your help guys!

Cheers for the link to DIN alternatives Geoff, looks like a nice selection there to look into.

Sorry for posting in wrong forum. : )
